Teasle.Action: Stops the car and gets out to talk to Rambo instead of ignoring him.
Warns Rambo that wearing the flag and looking the way he does can get him into trouble around here.
Offers to make sure Rambo doesn't head in the wrong direction and invites him into the car.
Asks Rambo questions about where he is headed and where he sleeps, showing some concern or interest.
Spots Rambo on the bridge and approaches him directly, initiating conversation and attempting to control the situation.
Stops the car and gets out to confront Rambo, showing confidence and assertiveness.
Attempts to gather information by asking Rambo questions about his destination and acquaintances, demonstrating investigative skill.
Invites Rambo into the car to 'make sure he doesn't head in the wrong direction,' showing a strategic move to maintain control over Rambo's movements.
Despite his efforts, fails to read Rambo's true intentions or the danger he poses, as Rambo remains distant and uncooperative internally.
Refuses to help Rambo get food locally, stating there is no soup kitchen and pushing him to leave town.
Asserts control by telling Rambo he asks the questions and not vice versa, showing a lack of tolerance and friendliness.
Veers the car to the curb upon noticing a sign indicating leaving town, showing situational awareness.
Questions Rambo about his destination and ride, demonstrating attentiveness and control of the interaction.
Refuses to provide help or directions beyond minimal information, showing a rigid and uncooperative attitude.
Asserts authority by telling Rambo he asks the questions, indicating confidence but also inflexibility.
Pushes Rambo without clear justification, escalating tension unnecessarily.
Tells Rambo he doesn't want guys like him around and prefers to keep things boring and controlled.
Gives Rambo unsolicited advice to cut his hair and clean up to avoid trouble.
Suddenly brakes to confront Rambo after seeing him walk away, demanding to know where he's going.
Grabs Rambo's arm to stop him and orders him to show ID and get against the car, showing aggressive law enforcement behavior.
Gives Rambo advice to cut his hair and clean up to avoid trouble.
Stops Rambo by pulling alongside and confronting him directly.
Attempts to assert authority by grabbing Rambo's arm and ordering him to show ID.
Puts hand on pistol and orders Rambo to get against the car, showing readiness to enforce law.
Fails to de-escalate the situation as Rambo easily breaks his grip and stares him down.
Pets Rambo down and finds a throwing knife, questions him aggressively about carrying it, does not show understanding of Rambo's explanation.
Issues commands brusquely, blasts the counter gate open with his hand, orders Rambo to move without politeness.
Finds a throwing knife on Rambo during pat down, questions the practicality of carrying such a knife, showing awareness and suspicion.
Issues clear commands to Rambo (e.g., 'Get against the car', 'Get in', 'Get over there - move!'), demonstrating control and authority.
Challenges Rambo with a locked stare and unspoken challenge, indicating confidence and psychological insight.
Blasts the paint-stuck counter gate open with the heel of his hand, showing physical assertiveness but possibly impulsive or aggressive behavior rather than measured competence.
Orders to book Rambo for multiple charges and sarcastically comments on his smell, showing no empathy.
Sternly stares at Rambo while escorting him, showing coldness and lack of friendliness.
Orders to book Rambo for multiple charges and directs officers to clean him up, showing control over the situation.
Starts toward his office while staring wiltingly at Rambo, possibly indicating hesitation or discomfort rather than confident engagement.
Threatens Rambo with violence, pressing truncheon into his cheek, and threatens to break his face.
Demands cooperation aggressively, showing impatience and hostility rather than understanding.
Uses intimidation and physical threats to try to coerce Rambo into compliance.
Fails to recognize that Rambo's resistance is not easily broken by threats, showing a lack of adaptability.
Questions Rambo about his behavior and warns him of legal consequences, attempts to assert control and order.
Orders Galt to clean Rambo up to make him presentable for court, implying a desire to help Rambo conform to societal expectations.
Confronts Rambo with clear authority, lays out legal consequences, and attempts to control the situation by ordering Rambo to comply and preparing him for court.
Relies on others (Galt) to enforce his commands rather than directly managing the situation himself.
Exits the room after giving orders instead of staying to ensure compliance or de-escalate the tension.
Is suggested as the person to be reported to and to be brought down to handle the situation, indicating a position of authority and expected competence.
No direct action or intervention shown in the excerpt despite escalating violence and mistreatment, indicating a possible omission or lack of timely involvement.
Commands to get Rambo down quickly, showing urgency and control over the situation.
Fails to recognize the severity of Rambo's mental state and the danger it poses, underestimating him.
Clamers down stairs toward Rambo during chaotic fight scene, but is easily catapulted over by Rambo and lands hard.
Quickly takes charge of the high-powered rifle and commands Galt to get help, showing decisiveness and leadership under pressure.
Dashes into a patrol car and pursues Rambo on the motorcycle, demonstrating prompt action and determination.
Follows Rambo closely through difficult terrain, maintaining pursuit despite obstacles.
Cruiser demolishes rails and sidespins but recovers quickly, showing vehicle control.
No indication of strategic adaptation or anticipation of Rambo's moves in this excerpt.
Wades through difficult terrain to investigate the crashed motorcycle, draws his sidearm cautiously but does not immediately use it.
Calls out to Rambo, attempting to communicate and warn him to stop, showing a desire to resolve the situation verbally.
Rams his shoulder against the jammed driver's door, then quickly adapts by scrambling across the front seat to the passenger door and escapes into the foliage.
Wades across a stream to the crashed motorcycle, draws his sidearm, and cautiously surveys the area.
Holsters his gun and calls out confidently to Rambo, attempting to assert control over the situation.
Despite his efforts, receives no response and is left with only silence, indicating a failure to anticipate or effectively engage with Rambo.
Orders Orval and his dogs to be brought up immediately, insists on using all available resources to capture Rambo, including citing obstruction on the spot.
Orders Orval and his dogs to the location, specifying the need for Dobermans that can hunt on sight, showing tactical awareness.
Demands the sawmill helicopter immediately and instructs Lester to cite anyone obstructing the order on the spot, demonstrating decisiveness and command presence.
Expresses confidence that they will get the fugitive with no problem, indicating self-assurance but possibly underestimating the challenge.
Keeps moving steadily with the posse, showing focus and leadership.
Shoots worried looks through the treetops, indicating concern for the situation.
Moves quickly and surely through familiar terrain, showing knowledge and confidence.
Carries a walkie-talkie and maintains communication, showing preparedness.
Keeps moving and stays focused despite weather and terrain challenges.
Relies on tracking dogs and team input to follow the target, showing practical use of resources.
Signals the helicopter onward toward the promontory, coordinating the posse's movement.
Receives information from the pilot about spotting Rambo and is expected to act on it.
Hears gunfire and immediately halts his posse, attempts to communicate with Galt via walkie-talkie to understand the situation.
Shows confusion and frustration in his communication ('What the hell's going on?'), indicating lack of situational awareness or control.
Orders Rambo to give himself up and stay where he is, threatens to shoot if he moves.
Fires two shots at Rambo after warning him.
Orders Rambo to give himself up and stay where he is, attempts to control the situation with clear commands.
Fires two shots at Rambo when he moves away despite warnings.
His men fire wildly into the tree line, accomplishing nothing but damaging the environment.
Insists on getting the chopper back immediately to retrieve Galt's body, showing concern for the fallen man.
Uses harsh language and shows impatience with the situation and others.
Commands the base to send a chopper immediately despite bad weather and difficult conditions, showing decisiveness and urgency.
Questions the accuracy of the intelligence about Rambo's background, showing critical thinking and caution.
Insists on following his orders despite warnings about the storm and risks, indicating confidence but possibly stubbornness.
Urges men to keep moving despite difficulties, showing determination and leadership.
Dismisses concerns of others with 'Shut up and move!'
Leads men in pursuit through difficult terrain and adverse weather conditions, showing persistence and command.
Dismisses Rambo as 'just one man who's wounded,' underestimating the opponent.
Commands his men to keep moving despite losing the scent, maintaining pressure on the target.
Shows frustration and impatience with his men’s concerns about the flood and possible enemy tactics.
Grabs Ward and urges him to keep moving, showing leadership and concern for group safety.
Commands to turn dogs loose to attack Rambo, showing willingness to use violence aggressively.
Crawls over to injured Orval and instructs men to put a tourniquet on his legs, showing care and responsibility for injured comrade.
Commands his men firmly to keep moving and to release the dogs to attack Rambo, showing control and decisiveness.
Crawls over to the wounded Orval and orders a tourniquet to be applied, demonstrating quick thinking and care under pressure.
Gives clear tactical instructions to surround the target and prevent escape.
Dismisses others' doubts with a sharp retort: 'Don't tell me what you don't know.'
Orders men to spread out and block all exits from the canyon, showing tactical awareness of the terrain and enemy movement.
Identifies the source of the gunfire and deduces the enemy is out of ammunition based on the number of shots fired.
Dismisses Mitch's doubts and insists on his plan despite uncertainty, showing confidence but possibly arrogance.
Encourages Belford to keep moving despite poor visibility and slow progress, attempting to maintain pressure on the enemy.
Commands his men to spread out and takes initiative to go a different way to find Ward, showing leadership and concern for his team.
Pauses and questions who is firing amidst wounded men's pleas, indicating some awareness and possible concern for the situation.
Charges forward aggressively in pursuit of Rambo, focused on capturing him rather than attending to wounded men.
Commands his men to spread out and takes initiative to go a different way to find Ward.
Pauses and questions who is firing, showing alertness and situational awareness.
Charges forward toward the gunfire, demonstrating decisiveness and willingness to engage.
Rushes in the direction of Balford's voice and locates him by following the moans, showing alertness and responsiveness.
Moves instinctively to go out to Balford but is driven back to cover by more lightning, showing situational awareness and caution.
Looks in a 360-degree circle and sees no trace of Rambo.
Charges toward position where he believes Rambo is.
Calls Rambo a coward and asserts 'you're mine' without confirming Rambo's location.
Refuses to relinquish responsibility despite injuries, insists on handling the situation himself.
Claims he treated the kid like a neighbor's kid and was doing him a favor.
Refuses to relinquish control despite injury and pressure, insists on handling the situation himself.
Oversteps jurisdiction and authority, causing tension with other officers.
Shows determination and focus on his men’s welfare despite personal pain.
Dismisses advice from a superior officer, potentially undermining cooperation.
Books a man on vagrancy and resisting arrest, stating 'I am doing my job' with intense suppressed anger.
Responds to offer of reinforcements with an appreciative look, showing willingness to collaborate.
Expresses determination to build a net so tight the fugitive will never get out, indicating a hard, uncompromising stance.
Books a man on vagrancy and resisting arrest, stating 'I am doing my job' with intense suppressed anger.
Expresses motivation and determination to build a net so tight the fugitive will never get out.
Acknowledges the need for reinforcements and shows appreciation for additional men offered.
Expresses anger and frustration, insists on strict law enforcement and punishing deputies if they mistreat prisoners.
Dismisses Lester impatiently, telling him to 'spit it out' harshly.
Shows fascination and curiosity when meeting Colonel Trautman, shakes his hand and listens.
Interrupts Trautman and tells him they are busy, showing impatience and lack of courtesy.
Expresses distrust and dislike toward Trautman, dismisses his involvement.
Acknowledges Trautman's concern and promises to be careful.
Engages in a tense exchange with Trautman, showing defensiveness and competitiveness.
Questions Trautman’s presence and doubts the usefulness of a full bird Colonel, asserting Rambo is his problem now.
Acknowledges Trautman’s concern and promises to be extra careful, showing some level of professional awareness.
Engages in a verbal exchange with Trautman, showing confidence and control over the situation.
Appears less than overwhelmed by Trautman’s warnings, indicating composure under pressure.
Dismisses Trautman’s military experience and underestimates Rambo’s capabilities.
Dismisses the death of civilians as 'a detail in the report.'
Calls Trautman 'sick' for admiring Rambo's killing skills, showing disdain for glorifying violence.
Dismisses collateral damage as a minor detail in official reports, showing a bureaucratic and callous attitude rather than strategic thinking.
Reads and references official documents about enemy tactics and medals, indicating some engagement with intelligence and military records.
Questions how the war was lost, showing some reflection on military outcomes.
Dismisses skill in killing as trivial compared to other skills, showing a lack of understanding or appreciation for combat expertise.
Expresses frustration and skepticism about handling Rambo, insists on doing his duty like heroes in Special Forces.
Dismisses Trautman's suggestion to 'defuse' the situation and let Rambo slip away, showing unwillingness to compromise for safety.
Shows signs of being unsettled and losing control, indicating some internal conflict or vulnerability.
Questions Trautman's plan and expresses skepticism about letting Rambo go, showing concern for his own department's duty and safety.
Dismisses Trautman's advice initially and struggles to accept the strategic patience required, indicating limited understanding of Special Forces tactics.
Acknowledges the seriousness of the situation and the potential for casualties, showing awareness of operational risks.
Appears unsettled and loses control emotionally when challenged by Trautman, revealing a momentary lapse in professional composure.
Invites Trautman to join him in taking Rambo out cleanly, showing a willingness to cooperate and possibly avoid unnecessary violence.
Accuses Trautman of possibly covering his own ass, indicating suspicion and distrust.
Takes a radio from a deputy to try to listen in on enemy communications.
Suggests using Trautman to talk Rambo into surrendering and setting him up for capture.
Shows some awareness of the tactical situation and attempts to coordinate efforts with Trautman.
Starts to say something but stops himself, realizing too much has already been said.
Accuses Trautman of not controlling the situation faster and implies they have to do 'dirty work'.
Questions Trautman skeptically about the fugitive's sanity and motives, showing distrust.
Observes the National Guardsmen trucks moving past and restrains himself from saying too much, indicating some self-control and awareness of the situation.
Questions Trautman about why the situation wasn't controlled faster, showing frustration but also a desire for accountability.
Accuses the fugitive of being insane and implies poor judgment in allowing him to join the service, showing a lack of deeper understanding of the fugitive's motivations.
Appears caught off guard by Trautman's explanation and fails to respond effectively, indicating a momentary lapse in confidence or adaptability.
Dismisses Rambo as a dangerous man who can only kill, showing distrust and harsh judgment.
Engages in a confrontational exchange with Trautman, refusing to acknowledge any responsibility for escalating the situation.
Questions Trautman's decision to use Rambo, showing skepticism about Rambo's capabilities beyond killing.
Denies responsibility for escalating the situation with Rambo despite evidence to the contrary.
Challenges Trautman aggressively but without clear strategic insight or understanding of Rambo's background.
Maintains a skirmish line and attempts to control the situation with guards reacting to shots and shouting.
Fails to anticipate Rambo's tactics fully, allowing him to evade and survive initial encounters.
Pulls up and parks the car, notices townspeople's reactions, and enters the station calmly.
Sits reading phone messages, leans back and closes eyes, succumbing to exhaustion and emotional fatigue before quickly sitting upright and exiting the office.
Apologizes for being abrupt, though insincerely.
Admits to feeling an empty, conflicted emotion about his role and violence.
Expresses a desire to protect people from violence despite aggressive impulses.
Shows impatience during conversation.
Engages in a tense but controlled conversation with Trautman, showing self-awareness about his role and moral conflict.
Admits to feeling an 'empty feeling' and a violent impulse contrary to his duty, revealing internal conflict and emotional agitation.
Apologizes for being abrupt but does so insincerely, indicating a lack of genuine emotional intelligence or interpersonal skill.
Says 'Well, it hasn't been what I'd call a pleasure but ... have a nice life, Colonel.' and shakes hands with Trautman.
Engages in a tense but controlled conversation with Trautman, showing some level of professional restraint and ability to manage the situation.
Expresses frustration and dismissiveness ('Well, it hasn't been what I'd call a pleasure but ... have a nice life'), indicating a lack of emotional intelligence or diplomacy.
Allows Trautman to handle the situation without interference, suggesting either trust in Trautman's competence or a lack of initiative to assert control.
Drives up to the scene and gives hurried instructions to his men, showing ability to take charge in a crisis.
Gives no confirmation or clear response to Trautman's suspicions, possibly indicating evasiveness or lack of clarity.
Observes Trautman silently and then orders him to clear out, showing some decisiveness but also possible dismissal of expert input.
Expresses determination to confront Rambo, showing a desire to maintain respect in town.
Prepares for violent confrontation by loading a pistol and unlocking a rifle rack.
Dismisses Trautman's warnings and advice, showing stubbornness and lack of openness.
Finishes loading the pistol and prepares for confrontation calmly and efficiently.
Locks the gun case and moves confidently into the main office despite warnings.
Selects a rifle from the rack with apparent purpose and readiness.
Ignores Trautman's warnings about the danger and consequences of his actions.
Shows determination to regain respect through confrontation, but underestimates the situation.
Directs loudspeaker message to clear the streets and instructs pedestrians to remain indoors for safety.
Quickly sweeps around from south to north despite confusing alarms and gunfire, showing alertness and situational awareness.
Sweat soaking his shirt and visible nervousness under pressure, indicating stress affecting his composure.
Freezes after setting off a third alarm, potentially compromising his position.
Contorts in pain but taunts Rambo to kill him, showing defiance rather than empathy.
Maintains eye contact with Rambo despite pain, indicating a form of sincerity in his challenge.
Fires at Rambo when he spots him, attempting to take control of the situation.
Falls down through the skylight after Rambo shoots toward it, indicating a failure to anticipate or avoid danger.
Contorts in pain but keeps his eyes on Rambo, showing mental toughness and focus under pressure.
Provokes Rambo verbally despite being in a vulnerable position, which may be seen as either confidence or recklessness.
Does not appear or act in this excerpt; no direct actions or statements from Teasle to evaluate competence.
